intro: Cathartolinum jamaicense, commonly known as Jamaican cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is occasionally cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and adaptability to warm climates.
